1.brief: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
a bottle (from the gurgling in emptying)
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)

2.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
near, with or among; often in general, to
a gorge (from its lofty sides; hence, narrow, but not a gully or winter-torrent)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way
an opening, i.e. door or gate
a potsherd, i.e. (by implication) a pottery; the name of a gate at Jerusalem
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
